intro: Lomaria semicylindrica, commonly known as the narrow-cylinder lomaria, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, cylindrical stems. The plant produces small, white or greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its leaves are narrow and often have a slight fragrance, contributing to its ornamental value. Lomaria semicylindrica prefers well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and dry landscapes.
